comment: Attendance isn't mandatory but it's good to start going at the and of the semester for the final group project. It's a 5 minute play, very easy. There were about 8 quizzes that were based on the textbook. You have to write an essay about a play, you must attend two. One can be online.

If you need an arts credit, take him!! He's awesome and his whole class can be done in less than 15 hours (excluding the final group project with mandatory attendance). Everything available day 1. Very caring. Participation grades on most assignments. Easy 100s on everything. Final performance was very fun and helped get me out of my comfort zone!
Really easy class, all assignments are due by the end of the semester and he's a pretty lenient grader. Take him!
he cares about what he does and is super passionate. a nice guy to be around TAKE HIM!

Professor Graham is a great professor. Attendance is never taken and all the work is due at the end of the semester. 10 retakable, untimed quizzes, 4 discussion posts, 2 mini assignments, and a group project final. An extremely easy A as long as you do all the work.

Chill person and professor. Coming to class isn't mandatory but in my opinion it was fun and rarely boring. One big group project at the end as your final. Quizzes are super easy and all have unlimited attempts and no deadlines. It is so much harder to fail this class than pass it.

Chill dude. Easy class, if you pay attention you can learn a bit. Very easy assignments and very few. Quizzes are free 100's online and unlimited attempts. One play for 30% of ur grade at the end but if you show up and say like 3 lines you get a 100. Easiest grader ever. He gets your here to get your fine arts Gen ED Done. Easiest class u will take
The easiest class ever. Most you can do online early and get out of the way, there's just a group project at the end. He's super chill and down to earth.

Literally the easiest professor you can take and is possibly the easiest class you'll take in college! He is a very nice and chill guy who only assigns ten tests throughout the semester and the questions are pulled straight from the textbook and you can retake the tests as many times as you need to get a 100% and a group project which is so easy!
Lectures aren't mandatory but pretty interesting if you do attend, he's a super chill guy who has a passion for art/theatre

Literally the easiest professor ever. 10 easy quizzes (Answers in the online textbook) & the quizzes are open the entire semster, you can retake them unlimited times. 2 event responses, and your final. Our group didn't put alot of effort on our final play and we still got a 100%. I passed this class with a 100%.

This was the best teacher I had taken my spring semester and the class was super duper easy and I loved how he gave us all the time we needed to get things done, even the group performance was really easy.

You will have 1 group project near the end of the semester, but other than that, he was a great professor, funny, caring, and honestly a very chill person. This is an easy A course that I would recommend to anyone who enjoys theatre and wants an A in class.
The only way to not get an A is if you don't do the work. The below reviews sum him up well. Take him!

you will have one group project at the end of the semester which is a group play. its actually kind of fun if you get a good group, also it isn't that serious if you mess up. you will also be given quizzes every week (all info is in the textbook) and the occasional discussion post which aren't hard at all. very hard to fail this class. TAKE HIM.

1 group final project. great teacher, i didn't show up to class until the group project around October. only assignments were 1 quiz a week and few super simple discussion posts throughout the semester. super chill and understanding!

Participation only matters in oct-dec for the final group project (a 5 min play on a social issue). Go to two performances write 750 words about one performance (not a serious paper btw it can be a run-on sentence literally he said tht). Quizzes r on textbook, open note, unlimited time and tries: ctrl+f will be ur friend fr tht

This is the easiest professor I have ever had. There are only a few quizzes that then you preform your own play, but it is very easy. You honestly don't need to come t class until late October/ November but you will really enjoy them if you do go. He is hilarious and the most down to earth professor ever. Love him and his class.

Take this class! Attendance is not mandatory until preparation for the final. All of the quizzes are on the textbook readings and you have unlimited attempts. You only have to see one in-person KSU performance and one online performance. It's a super laid back class that basically guarantees an easy a, I highly recommend!!
He is very chill, caring/understanding, and you can tell he loves theater. I would take him again if I had to.

one of the best teachers I have ever taken. was actually excited to attend this class even tho attendance is not mandatory. he is super fun and chill. 9 quizzes to take at any point in the semester with unlimited attempts. final grade is a group skit for 5 minutes. few discussions that are simple and completion. wish all my teachers were like this

Prof Tyler is the best!!! Attendance is not mandatory and his lectures are decently interesting. His grades are just 10 quizzes (online and open book), four discussion posts, two events, and a final group project. His class is such an easy A and he's just so caring and compassionate. I definitely recommend taking him!!

I love professor Tyler. If you have a full schedule and need to get this gen ed out of the way I highly suggest taking his class. Attendance isn't mandatory for the first couple months but once you start group work you do have to show up to class. All quizzes are online, no tests, and they are very easy.
He's amazing. Genuinely there are no flaws with this teacher or this class. Take him if you can

Awesome class and professor! There are 10 short quizzes + a few discussions, which you can take at any time (it's easier to do them with the class). Attendance is mandatory in the 2nd half (but you can miss one) for the enjoyable group performance final. You also need to attend 2 plays. Textbook is online (free?) and is needed for the quizzes.

Tyler is so nice; you will do well in this class. Unlimited attempts on the quizzes and they are open all semester. One group project at the end where attendance becomes mandatory. You need to see two shows and you only write a paper on one. 4 discussion posts. The lectures are valuable for his personality and if you enjoy theater.

He is an amazing professor!! The class consists of 9 quizzes, a few discussion boards, watching 2 plays/musicals but writing only one paper, and there is a group project at the very end of the semester. Overall, it's very easy to manage so don't stress about it. I highly recommend anyone to take this class!! It's the best choice you'll ever make!!

Oh my gosh I wish I could only take classes taught by him! He is the best and I learned a lot without being stressed about what my grade would end up as. 10 quizzes, attend 2 performances (play, stand up, etc), and a group skit as the final. Attendance isn't mandatory, but just come, it's a great class. It was a great way to start off college!

I absolutely love this professor. I am not a big theater person but I enjoyed this class. Almost everything is a participation grade and all of the quizzes are open note, unlimited time, and unlimited attempts. They are also all straight from the textbook. The final group project is very easy to get a 100 on as long as you show up.

I took Tyler for intro theatre class and I could not recommend him enough. He makes the necessary content actually interesting for the lectures. Half way through the semester you just work on the final project which is a skit group project and you only have to show up once a week. Please take this class if you need if for the category.

Professor Tyler is super chill and it was a very easy class. He even managed to make his lectures pretty interesting. The last half of the semester is a group project which is pretty much graded on participation, so just show up and it is pretty much impossible not to get a good grade in his class. Quizzes and paper are not due til the last day.

Attendance not mandatory. All assignments due at the end of semester. One paper based on a play you had to see in person and Group Play as final assignment. We also discussion post which are fairly easy. Had chapter quizzes based on the textbook so it was open book. Overall wonderful professor!

No due dates for this class, you will receive full credit as long as you submit your assignments by the final. The final is a group project where you must write and perform a 5-minute play about a social issue. Professor Graham is super chill and dresses like he only listens to Led Zeppelin and I love it. Impossible to fail, fun and relaxed.
Take this class! its the most fun and easy class you will take but only if you take Tyler!

He was such a sweet professor. He knows most of the people in his class take for the necessary credit so his class isn't hard. There was one quiz a week over strictly the textbook no need to actually read the book or attend the lectures. One major group project that counts as ur final that you have to act for 3-5 mins. overall great and an easyA
Easy Professor that wants you to just have fun and step out of your comfort zone for the sole purpose of his entertainment (I think). Great guy honestly

Easy A! There were weekly quizzes & a few easy discussions. The final is a 3-5 minute group performance (automatic A). There are 2 really easy writing assignments. Assignments can be completed up until the final exam period.

I have never been a theater kid but when I saw how much work my art class was going to be I dropped it and took theater with Tyler instead. Best decision I ever made. Continuously keeps class interesting and fun for the people that come. Quizzes are quick and easy. One final group performance at the end of the course but we had so much fun with it!
If you are looking for an easy arts elective, this is the professor for you.

Incredibly easy class, I took it as an elective. All of the homework was straight out of the book, and the writing assignments were super short. The most stressful part was the short group play at the end of the semester, but it really wasn't that bad, and as long as you say something you pass.

If I could rate the difficulty a zero I would, he is super easy and chill. He doesn't require attendance until group projects. His quizzes are super easy, open book, and you have unlimited attempts. The group project was easy and as long as you did it you get an A. He's also really funny. This class is an easy A as long as you do the work.
TAKE THIS CLASS! SO EASY AND ENJOYABLE! all of the grades are super easy to get a 100% on!! the final is a group project SO EASY!! TAKE HIM!
This is the best professor for a theatre class!

TAKE THIS CLASS! He's super understanding and will give you a 100% on everything you turn in. The quizzes have unlimited attempts and come straight from the textbook. They are also open note. The final is a group project so please don't be rude and miss all of the rehearsals. Other than that attendance is optional and hw is self explanatory.
This professor is one of the best professors you can ever take, and its a easy A. You won't regret your decision.

The most chill teacher. He does not require attendance until the group project starts. But his lectures were still very entertaining and I would still go to his classes. He makes theatre easy to learn. Quizzes are open book and can be retaken. Easiest A but also super enjoyable class.
for sure the funniest professors I have ever had, out of all of the art appreciation classes you have to take, take this one!!

His class is really easy, if you got a B that means you weren't even trying. His Quizzes are very simple and from the book but if you don't get the book you have unlimited chances so you should be fine. Attendance isn't really mandatory until the group projects start at the end of the semester. Just make sure you complete your assignments in D2L!!

Honestly, showing up to class is your grade. We don't do much. We have quizzes out of the textbook but even those are open book. One group project at the end, and its not that difficult. Pretty interesting class but I took for a gen ed requirement. If need be, I would take him again.
I recommend this professor for a easy A!!

His class is very easy. I took his class all online, but the material and his tests are really easy to understand. He got back to me quickly if I ever had questions. His projects and DBAs were easy. Even though I didnt have him in class, he seemed like a very nice guy. I would definitely recommend taking him for TPS 1107.

This class was a breeze. Assignments were actually fun and quizzes and assignments were easy and not graded very hard. Tyler was very laid back and would often push back deadlines and tried to make the class as easy as possible. Would for sure recommend.
Such an amazing professor who cares about his students. Honestly harder to fail the class, it's that easy. Test and quizzes are open note with many attempts. Super easy for an elective class.

I loved this professor, he was very laid back and down to earth. Very understanding about late work and missing assignments. This was a very relaxed class and had pretty fun assignments that went along with it. He also has a really cool back story and resume which had me inspired by this man. Highly recommend taking this class.
The reviews are true, you cannot go wrong with Prof. Graham. He is very kind and understanding of the circumstances regarding COVID. Easy grader, generous surprises, light work, take him!

TAKE HIM! He is the most caring prof. His tests, and quizzes are extremely easy. He is always trying to make the class easy for the students. He is super caring about his students and wants everyone to pass. Do the work and you will pass easily.
He makes the class fun! I laughed a lot during his acting exercises.

This was a really fun class. Definitely take, he is really laid back and the activities and lectures are all good. You have online quizzes each week, but they are easy and can find answers on Quizlet. You will have to see 3 performances and write a response paper for 1 of them and one group project. It should be an easy A, if you do assignments.

TAKE HIS CLASS! It is super easy and laid back. He didn't start taking attendance until halfway through the semester. Most of the online quiz answers are on google. He is relatable and funny. He also has been in a lot of TV shows like OITNB, Mr. Robot and more. Great guy and class.
Extremely funny professor that gives great lectures. Assignments are very easy and the class is fun overall. 10/10 would take again!

Hes very easygoing and makes lectures genuinely fun! The final is a group-project where you create a 5 minute short play, but hes very clear about grading based on individual achievement. The weekly quizzes are simple. Hes also incredibly understanding and empathetic. If you have a problem, hell do all he can do help as long as you communicate!

Professor Graham makes this class enjoyable! He is the best theatre teacher. There are weekly quizzes, 1 group project, and 3 plays you have to go to and write discussion posts on. EASY!! He is very laid back and does not make this elective class hard or difficult at all. TAKE HIM!!

This class is so easy and chill one quiz once a week but it is super easy. Don't waste money on the textbook because it was never used. Attendance is taken when you get to the group project stage towards the middle. Really laid back young teacher 100% recommend easy A. BUT be prepared to PAY for 3 plays... unless you volunteer!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: There is not even one bad thing to say about this professor! He is extremely lenient and does a great job of getting students to work together. He gives weekly quizzes, but they are very easy to do. There are zero tests, as your major grades are from going to plays and doing a group project for the final. If this professor is available, SIGN UP!
Super great professor. What I loved about his class is that he knows that no one was a theatre major in his class, so he doesn't expect broadway perfection. Easy grader and I had fun in the class

I would highly recommend Tyler as a professor! He really tries to make sure everyone has a fair chance for an A. Hes very laid back, respects students and their time, and is self aware and knowledgeable. If you have to take a the arts of class, take him! He really is a cool guy and is passionate about what he does.

Very easy class and laid back professor. You're required to go see 3 plays, 2 on campus and 1 off campus. The 2 on campus plays are specified but the off campus one is your choice as long as he approves it. 3 page essay for the last on campus play and other than that, all semester is just weekly online quizzes, and 1 3 min skit group project final.

TAKE THIS CLASS! An amazing professor who is very laid back and willing to listen to any concerns you have. The first half of the semester was mostly lectures and 10 ? quizzes every Friday (all the answers are in the online textbook typically in bold so super easy). The second half was with a group working on the final. Tyler is freaking awesome!!!

Tyler is a really open minded and relaxed teacher. Hes really flexible and makes class fun. Hes easy to get in contact with and makes class enjoyable. I definitely would recommend taking him, especially if youre not a theatre major since he makes the class fun even for those who arent interested in theatre.

Tyler is so relaxed and makes class fun. I took this class as a hybrid so on Mondays there would be a lecture, Wednesdays an activity, and Fridays an online quiz straight from the book. His final is a group project where you must make a 3-5 minute scene. Must also see 3 shows outside of class, but that's mandatory for all TPS 1107 classes at KSU
Great teacher, just show up and you have an A

He was the most laid back prof i've ever had and he really is so caring of his students to make sure you don't fail. He's great at lecturing and doesn't require you to take notes. You'll have a group project play as your final and it is actually a fun assignment to work on!

Each day in class is different and fun. No work load. only work we did was drawing ur own "costume"on a blank figure. He is super funny and super chill. My class was hybrid so class mon and wed and then small 10 question quiz on Fridays that are straight from book or in my case quizlet easy A class. no final- easy group project instead
